intro: Monactis kingii, commonly known as the King's monactis, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
